quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Lyric and Song

questions.question: The soundtrack of this Broadway musical includes the popular song Tomorrow with the famous chorus:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Annie

questions.question: These lyrics are excerpted from Frankie Smiths one-hit single Double Dutch Bus. People often mishear this lyric as:  Get on the bus, pay your fare. Tell the driver that your dogs going to a Double Dutch Affair.  Which of the following is the proper lyric?

options.text: Get on the bus, pay your fare. Tell the driver that youre going to a Double Dutch Affair.
Get on the bus, case the air. Tell the driver that youre going to a Double Dutch Affair.
Get on the bus, dont forget your fare. Tell the driver that youre going to a Double Dutch Affair.
Keg on the bus, fake the fare, and the drivers gonna take you to a Double Dutch affair.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Get on the bus, pay your fare. Tell the driver that youre going to a Double Dutch Affair.

questions.question: This English singer and multi-talented performer released the 1999 song Thursdays Child featuring the memorable lyrics:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: David Bowie

questions.question: Heres a well known misheard lyric from a mostly 70s group, Steely Dan:  Are you reelin in the eaves, throwin away some fun?  Choose the correct lyric..

options.text: Reelin in the EEes, blowing away the sun?
Reelin in the years, stowing away the time?
Dealin in the east, going away for some?
Reelin in the beers, stowing away the sun?

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Reelin in the years, stowing away the time?

questions.question: This one is from the album Frampton Comes Alive, by Peter Frampton:  Do you feel like a dude?  Whether you do or not,  please give the correct lyric.

options.text: Do you feel like I do?
Do you feel like a zoo?
Do you feel like a broom?
Do you field like I do?

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Do you feel like I do?

questions.question: Which song, released in January 1967 by the Rolling Stones, featured these lines:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ruby Tuesday

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Friday Im in love

questions.question: This is an easy one from Jimi Hendrixs Purple Haze.  The often misheard lyric is scuse me , while I kiss this guy! What is the correct lyric?

options.text: scuse me, while I kiss this stye!
scuse me, while my kid supplies!
scuse me, while my kilts so high!
scuse me, while I kiss the sky!

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: scuse me, while I kiss the sky!

questions.question: From Wang Chungs Dancehall Days:  We were cool on Christ.  Select the correct lyric.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: We were cool on craze

questions.question: This one is from Nightrangers Sister Christian.  Here is the misheard lyric:  At the motor inn, whats your price for fright?  Now, select the correct lyric.

options.text: An Imodium, whats your price for light?
Youre motoring, whats your price for flight?
And the mode youre in, whats your price for lice?
Deodorant, whats your price for fight?

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Youre motoring, whats your price for flight?

questions.question: From Totos Africa:  I miss the waves down in Africa!   Give the correct lyric.

options.text: I felt a thang down in Africa
I bless the rain down in Africa
I felt the pain down in Africa
I felt the rain down in Africa

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: I bless the rain down in Africa

questions.question: Great Moment in Music:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Leonard Nimoy

questions.question: This mondegreen comes all the way live out of the mists of 1983.  The group is Men at Work. The song is Overkill.  Heres the misheard lyric:  Day after day, I drink a beer. Night after night, my heartbeat shows the beer. Toast to beer and fade away.  Quite a mouthful, but so is the correct lyric, listed below. Which one is it?

options.text: Day after day, it reappears. Night after night, Im feeling oh, so clean. Oh so clean and fade away.
Day after day, it reappears. Night after night, my heartbeat shows the fear.  Ghosts appear and fade away.
Day after day, it reappears. Night after night, Im feeling Josephine, Jose, those feelings fade away.
Day after day, it reappears. Night after night, Im feeling Clozepine, Clozepine and fade away.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Day after day, it reappears. Night after night, my heartbeat shows the fear.  Ghosts appear and fade away.

questions.question: This one is a classic.  From The Eagles seminal hit Hotel California, give the correct lyric.   This is the misheard lyric:  Renting a room at the Hotel California.  Choose the correct lyric.

options.text: Plenty of you, at the Hotel California
Plenty of gloom, at the Hotel California
Plenty of room at the Hotel California
Pretty in bloom, at the Hotel California.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Plenty of room at the Hotel California

questions.question: Lets go way back to 1981.  Kim Carnes is spinning a yarn, something about Bette Davis Eyes. One of the lyrics sounds like:  What it takes to make a crow blush, but certainly that cant be right!  What is the correct lyric from this song?

options.text: what it takes to make a pro blush
What it takes to make a corn rush
What it takes to make a slow bus
What it takes to make a low slush

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: what it takes to make a pro blush

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 28 October 1981

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kill Em All

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bridget Joness Diary

options.text: Lucy In The Sky With Diamonds

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Come Together

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Song and Mother
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, raiders, title. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Bob Dylan was a major spokesman for the young people growing up in the 60s and 70s.

options.text: n you name the title of this song?

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Masters of War

questions.question: We are sick and tired of your ism and schism game

options.text: e and go to heaven in Jesus name

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bob Marley

questions.question: The title of the song, Mama Tried, written by Merle Haggard suggests that even with all her hard work and love, she failed to save her wayward son. What happened to this rebel child who despite all his Sunday learning toward the bad he kept on turning.?

options.text: In a long black veil she cries ovre his bones
Hes going back to New Orleans to wear that ball and chain.
He turned twenty one in prison doing life without parole
He shot a man in Reno just to watch him die.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He turned twenty one in prison doing life without parole

questions.question: Who recorded the popular song Jimmy Mack that was a hit single in 1967, hitting #1on the RB charts?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Martha and the Vandellas

questions.question: Three Dog Night wailed, This is the craziest party there ever could be. People are smoking strange cigarettes and, when he looked for his girlfriend, shes passed out on the floor. What advice did Mama give that was ignored?

options.text: Mama Told Me Not to Come
Mama Told Me Theyd Be Days Like This
Take the Last Train to Clarkesville

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mama Told Me Not to Come

questions.question: In 1971 Paul Revere and the Raiders sang a song that highlights the plight of the American Indians.  Some of the lyrics are the following:  Took away our native tongue and taught their English to our young.  And all the beads we made by hand are nowadays made in Japan.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cherokee

questions.question: Steve Goodman wrote the perfect country and western song for David Allen Coe. Coe said that a perfect country and western song had to have something about: Mama, trains, trucks, prison and getting drunk.  What was Mamas fate in the perfect country and western song?

options.text: She said farewell and left on the midnight train
She got drunk the day I had to go to prison
She left for the station in her pick-up truck
She got hit by a damned old train

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: She got hit by a damned old train

questions.question: Now that he has turned twenty one Smokeys mother is full of advice: The women come and the women gonna go.  Dont be sold on the very first one. Pretty girls come a dime to the dozen.  What did his mom advice him to do before saying, I do?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Shop Around

questions.question: Blood on the leaves and blood on the root is a line from Billie Holidays song Strange Fruit.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lynchings

questions.question: Levon was a song named after Levon Helm, the drummer from The Band.  Who recorded this song in 1971?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Elton John

questions.question: Janis Joplin recorded Bobbie McGee in 1970, a few days before her death. Can you name the singer of King of the Road, who had a hit with the song Bobbie McGeea year before Joplin did.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roger Miller

questions.question: Sarge, Im only eighteen, I got a ruptured spleen
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Draft Dodger Rag

questions.question: The caller was just trying to tell the mother that he only wanted to say good bye to her daughter. The mother kept saying Please dont say nothing to make her start crying and stay. And the operator keeps saying over and over 40 cents more for the next three minutes. Whose mother turned a deaf ear to the callers plea?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sylvias Mother

questions.question: Fill in the blank from the lyrics to Smells Like Teen Spirit:

options.text: mulatto, an albino, a ______, my libido. Yay!

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: mosquito

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rocky Top
